result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrel James Tio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. No contact with J. Hieronimus directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.
Defendant to complete a Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program or Anger Managment together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full - bond previously posted has been applied.

Case called @ 1:16 p.m. Defendant Darrel James Tio in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant previously entered NC pleas as to Counts 4 & 5. PSI filed and received by all parties. Atty Lennon makes two clarifications to the PSI. DA Blader offers no corrections or clarifications. Chapter 950 compliance addressed - Victim is present in the courtroom. Statement by the victim. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Lennon. Statement by DE. Court orders: Ct 4 - 4 years bifurcated SEH - 2 yrs IC/2 yrs ES consecutive to any existing sentence - I/S - 3 years probation - Conditions:  6 mos WCJ - Huber, No GT, 30 days CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than 4/1/2015, DAAP or Anger Managment and follow through, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, no contact w/ J. Hieronimus, Rest in the amount of $1256.71, Costs to include the DNA surcharge w/ 60 DTP or PP. Ct 5 - 1 year WCJ consecutive to any existing sentence - Huber, GT, 30 CFTS - I/S - 2 years probation concurrent with Ct 4 - Same conditions as Count 4 with the exception of jail time. Defendant is eligible for SAP. Defendant is not eligible for CIP. The court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction. Bond previously posted to be applied. Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on February 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
from Atty William Lennon Re: Withdrawal of Plea Motion, Motion Hrg Scheduled for 12/9/14, Motion for Withdrawal of Plea will not be filed

Case called @ 9:10 a.m. Defendant Darrel James Tio in court with attorney William M. Lennon.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Lennon recently put on the case. Attorney Lennon - DE is wishing to withdraw his pleas and more time is needed to work through the matter. Sentencing hearing on December 9, 2014 to be changed to a Motion Hearing to withdraw the plea. Motion to be filed by no later than November 21, 2014. The court will suspend the PSI in the event that the pleas are withdrawn. If there is no request to withdraw plea Atty Lennon to correspond with the court and the Order for PSI will be reactivated.

10:57 am case called. Defendant Darrel James Tio in court with attorney Jonathan Thomas Groh.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Resolution has been reached and defendant will enter a plea today. Request for PSI from the State. State places on record limitations of argument with recommendation with PSI. Clarification by Attorney Groh.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Attorney Groh confirms receipt of Information previously filed, waives further formal reading. Plea: No Contest to Counts 4 & 5.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC and sets matter for sentencing. Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 1, 2, 3, 6, 7, & 8. Court orders a PSI to be completed.  Court reminds defendant regarding bond and conditions.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Restitution Summary - $1256.71
from Victim Re: Amended to No Contact Provisions

Plea hearing on September 25, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Case Called @ 9:53 AM: Defendant Darrel James Tio in court with attorney Jonathan Thomas Groh.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Per DA:  It is believed matter will not proceed to plea today.  Per Atty Groh:  Amendment to offer has been received and being considered.  PSI request being considered.  Per DA:  Victim present in courtroom and is requesting contact and amendment to bond.  The Court:  Respectfully declines at this juncture to amend bond conditions due to allegations.  No contact to be absolutely followed as ordered - no modifications.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 25, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Case Called @ 2:00 PM: Defendant Darrel James Tio in court, in custody, with attorney Jonathan Thomas Groh, both appearing in person.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Per Atty Groh:  Preliminary discussions have taken place on resolution which will result in waiver of pre-lim today.  Per DA:  State confirms off on 2 counts and will be requesting PSI.  Colloquy undertaken as to State's offer on resolution and how State will be bound by terms of offer.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Def BOT.  INFO Filed.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP received and entered as to all Counts.  State argues as to non-monetary conditions of bond to include 2 more individiuals.  Argument by Atty Groh:  No objection to the no contact request being requested by the State.  Also argues as to cash bond amount of $3000 - requests modification to Signature or reduced amount of cash.  If released, Def would reside with grandmother.  The Court:  Respectfully declines to amend monetary conditions of bond - $3000 cash bond to remain as previously ordered.  The Court will however amend no contact provisions in addition to all other conditions of bond previously established to include KK and/or JK.  In person STC possible Plea Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
